description: The problem detail segment contains the data necessary to add, update, correct, and delete the problems of a given individual.

1.name: Action Code
1.description: This field contains the intent of the message. Refer to HL7 table 0287 - Problem/goal action code for valid values.
1.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

10.name: Problem Classification
10.description: This field indicates the kind of problem. This field can be used to categorize problems so that they may be managed and viewed independently within different applications (e.g., admission, final, post-operative, pre-operative, outpatient, discharge, etc.).

11.name: Problem Management Discipline
11.description: This field indicates the category of caregiver with responsibility for managing this specific problem (e.g., care team, nursing, medicine, respiratory therapy, occupational therapy, dietary etc.). This is a repeating field to allow identification of all disciplines who may have the responsibility for this problem.

12.name: Problem Persistence
12.description: This field contains the perseverance of a problem (e.g., acute, chronic, etc.).

13.name: Problem Confirmation Status
13.description: This field contains the verification status of a problem (e.g., confirmed, differential, provisional, rule-out, etc.).

14.name: Problem Life Cycle Status
14.description: This field contains the current status of the problem at this particular date/time (e.g., active, active-improving, active-stable, active-worsening, inactive, resolved, etc.).

15.name: Problem Life Cycle Status Date/Time
15.description: This field indicates the effective date/time of the current problem life cycle status.

16.name: Problem Date of Onset
16.description: This field contains the date/time when the problem began.

17.name: Problem Onset Text
17.description: This field allows for a textual representation of the time when the problem began.

18.name: Problem Ranking
18.description: This field contains a user-defined prioritization of a problem (e.g., numeric ranking, or the use of words such as 'primary,' 'secondary,' etc.).

19.name: Certainty of Problem
19.description: This field contains a qualitative representation of the certainty of a problem (e.g., HI - high, LO - low, ME - medium, etc.).

2.name: Action Date/Time
2.description: This field contains the date/time that the operation represented by the action code was performed.

20.name: Probability of Problem
20.description: This field contains a quantitative or numeric representation of the certainty that the problem exists for this patient. This field has a valid range of 0 to 1. For example, a healthcare provider may be 75% (.75) sure that the problem has been correctly identified.

21.name: Individual Awareness of Problem
21.description: This field contains the individual's comprehension of the problem (e.g., full, marginal, partial, etc.).

22.name: Problem Prognosis
22.description: This field contains the prognosis for the individual's problem (e.g., good, poor, etc.).

23.name: Individual Awareness of Prognosis
23.description: This field contains the individual's comprehension of the prognosis for the problem (e.g., full, marginal, partial, etc.).

24.name: Family/Significant Other Awareness of Problem/Prognosis
24.description: This field indicates the individual's family or significant other's comprehension of the actual problem/prognosis.

25.name: Security/Sensitivity
25.description: This field contains information about the level of security and/or sensitivity surrounding the problem (e.g., highly sensitive, not sensitive, sensitive, etc.).

3.name: Problem ID
3.description: This field identifies the problem. This is the identifier from an institution's master list of problems.

4.name: Problem Instance ID
4.description: This field contains the identifier assigned by an initiating system to an instance of a problem.

5.name: Episode of Care ID
5.description: This field uniquely identifies the episode of care to which this problem applies. (See note under 'Ongoing issues.')

6.name: Problem List Priority
6.description: This field prioritizes this problem on a list that is maintained for the individual.

7.name: Problem Established Date/Time
7.description: This field contains the date/time when the corresponding problem was initially identified by the caregiver.

8.name: Anticipated Problem Resolution Date/Time
8.description: This field contains the estimated date/time for resolving the stated problem.

9.name: Actual Problem Resolution Date/Time
9.description: This field contains the date/time that the problem was actually resolved.
